author: Sean Ingram (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Rockets surpass Cyclones in overtime
text: Rockets surpass Cyclones in overtime by Sean Ingram The Courier Your Messenger For The River Valley 08:34 AM, Tuesday, October 13 2015 | 49 views | 0 | 0 | | LITTLE ROCK — Like two weeks ago against Bryant, the Russellville Cyclones came from behind, this time with 21 straight points and led the Little Rock Catholic Rockets 21-17 into the fourth quarter.The Rockets took a 24-21 lead with 2:12 to go, but Nathan Turner hit a 30-yard field goal to send Friday night’s 7A/6A-Central Conference game into overtime at War Memorial Stadium.Catholic quarterback Andre Sale threw a touchdown pass in the OT possession, but Russellville came up short, couldn’t get in the end zone and fell 24-21 to the Rockets.Little Rock Catholic (2-4, 1-2 7A/6A-Central Conference) took a 7-0 lead with 9:29 to go in the first quarter after a 17-yard run up the middle into the end zone by Monroe McKay.The Cyclones (1-5, 0-3) couldn’t convert on fourth-and-1 on its first possession, and the Rockets responded quickly by covering 46 yards in three plays. Sale covered 42 of those yards with his pass to Thompson Olaimey. Chris Elser’s point-after kick made it 14-0 still in the first quarter.After Russellville forced Catholic to punt, the Cyclones ended the shutout with a 51-yard touchdown pass from quarterback Cale Fulsom to Caleb Stokes. Turner’s PAT pulled Russellville within 14-7 with 6:06 remaining in the first quarter. The Cyclones went 80 yards in just four plays and needed only one minute to score.Russellville’s defense forced the Rockets to sputter again, so the Cyclones offense covered 68 yards in just three plays and took another minute. Fulsom’s 55-yard pass to Stokes tied the game with 2:21 left in the first quarter after the Turner PAT.Russellville regained the lead when Fulsom threw a 34-yard touchdown toss to James Woods, his first TD catch of the season, with 6:26 to go in the first half. Turner’s PAT made it 21-14.Catholic answered when Lance Harville-Thomas came out of the backfield and caught a 33-yard pass from Sale inside the Rockets 10. Elser hit a 22-yard field goal to close within 21-17 with 1:05 left in the second quarter.That’s the way the scoreboard read until late in the game. Fulsom finished the first half with 9-of-11 passing for 192 yards and three touchdowns.Tyler Bailey stopped the Rockets three yards short of a first down at the Cyclones’ 13 and stopped a potential score. But RHS needed two yards on fourth down, and was stopped after 12 plays and 65 yards to the Catholic 22-yard line, where the Rockets took over on downs.Catholic’s special teams kicked just a 7-yard punt to the Cyclones in the fourth quarter, but got the ball back with five minutes to go.The Rockets put together a 54-yard, eight-play drive that was kept alive when Sale scrambled for his life and got less than a yard away from a first down at the Russellville 6. But he got the first down on the next play, and later Harville-Thomas went up the middle for the touchdown and regained the lead with 2:12 to go. Elser’s PAT made it 24-21.Two straight passes to Steven Baty gave Russellville a first down at the Catholic 33. Jackson Hickey carried inside the 25. Fulsom hit Baty on a slant pass for a first down at the 16 with 43 seconds to go.Hickey carried to the 10, and the Cyclones took their final time out with 25 seconds showing.But Russellville was hit with an intentional grounding penalty, which meant a 5-yard loss all the way back to the 19. Fulsom’s next pass was incomplete, but Baty was hit while the pass was in the air.The personal foul penalty gave the Cyclones a third down at the 12 with 10 seconds to go. Russellville ran out Turner for the 30-yard field goal, and he tied the game 24-24 with five seconds left after the 59-yard, 11-play scoring drive.The Rockets got the first overtime possession at the 10-yard line. On third down, Sale threw to a wide-open receiver in the end zone. Elser’s PAT gave the Rockets a 31-24 lead.Now, the Cyclones had four chances to score and tie the game. Hickey was wrapped up for a 2-yard loss. Fulsom was sacked back at the 22, then his next pass to the 5 was incomplete.Russellville had one shot, but Fulsom’s pass into the end zone was incomplete.Fulsom finished the game 18-of-128 or 288 yards, three touchdowns and no interceptions. Stokes had 137 yards on six catches, while Steven Baty caught seven passes for 59 yards. The Cyclones finished with 367 yards, compared to 356 for Little Rock Catholic.Russellville hosts Van Buren next week.
